thread.title: H.S. Female Athlete of the Week: Natalie Alechko of NV/Old Tappan - Athlete of the Week
thread.title_full: H.S. Female Athlete of the Week: Natalie Alechko of NV/Old Tappan - Athlete of the Week - NorthJersey.com

author: CHUCK O'DONNELL
title: H.S. Female Athlete of the Week: Natalie Alechko of NV/Old Tappan - Athlete of the Week
text:
When the ball starts zooming over the net and players hurl their bodies all over the court, and the heat of the match reaches a fever pitch, Natalie Alechko is reminded of why she loves volleyball.
"I think most volleyball players would agree it's just how fast the game is and the speed of the game," the NV/Old Tappan senior said.
"There's a real intensity on the court and you can see it from the stands. All my friends who come to watch our games are like, 'Volleyball is so cool.' "
Anyone who watched last week saw Alechko play three great matches and help the Golden Knights defeat Ramapo, Ridgewood and Paramus.
The Record Female Athlete of the Week had 31 kills, 18 digs and four aces as NV/Old Tappan ran its record to 8-0.
The outside hitter said part of the reason for the team's success has been its new, more toned-down attitude.
"I think that's our mentality this year; stay calm," Alechko said.
"In previous years, we've had almost a frantic or nervous energy if we felt the game was getting tight. I think this year we're focusing on having fun on the court and staying relaxed."
She's also trying to stay relaxed when it comes to the all-important decision on where to go to college next year.
Wherever she goes, she said she has her heart set on playing volleyball and studying law.
"I dream of being a corporate lawyer," Alechko said. "I know it doesn't sound like the most interesting thing in the world, but I'm really interested in the law and writing.
"My friend Libby [Scott] … her dad actually gave me some really great advice.
"It kind of inspired me to — not go in his path — but mold my path around what he did. I kind of saw myself following the same route."
Also nominated: Remi Nunziato of Rutherford and Mikaela Heyboer of Park Ridge for soccer; Amanda Manzo of Bogota for volleyball.
